titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Jack Belden Papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Aparna Mukherjee

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-06-01T14:59-0700

did.abstract: Correspondence, news dispatches, and other writings, relating primarily to the Sino-Japanese War, American military operations in North Africa, France, Belgium and Germany, the occupation of Germany, and the publication of China Shakes the World. Includes correspondence with Agnes Smedley.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Jack Belden Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection was acquired by the Hoover Instituion Archives in 1990.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Graduated, Summit High School, New Jersey
Seaman - Java, Phillippines, Germany, and South America
Reported on the Second Sino-Japanese War for the United Press International
Covered Italy, North Africa, and Burma for Time and Life magazines

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The papers of Jack Belden cover his career as an American journalist. He was a foreign correspondent in China during the Second Sino-Japanese War; in China, Burma, North Africa, and Europe during World War II; and in China during the Civil War.

The materials, consisting of correspondence, news dispatches, writings, diary, and notes, relate primarily to the Second Sino-Japanese War, American military operations in North Africa, France, Belgium, and Germany, the occupation of Germany, the publication of China Shakes the World, and reviews of his writings. An insight into United States Army operations in Europe and the Far East during World War II is also provided.
The Jack Belden papers were acquired originally in 1990. Incremental materials, received in 2008, have been added alphabetically at the end of the register by the original series.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged into seven series: Biographical File, Correspondence, Office File, Writings, United States Army File, Incremental Material, and Oversize Material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings, diary, and identification cards, arranged alphabetically by physical form

did.unittitle: Clippings about Jack Belden's injury sustained in Oran, Western Algeria, and from Who's Who in the East,
Identification cards issued by British forces, and United States Army Forces in the Middle East, Cairo, Egypt,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Arranged alphabetically by name of correspondent

did.unittitle: Colonel Unni Nayar Commemoration Volume Committee,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings and printed matter, newspaper dispatches, notes, and telegrams relating to Jack Belden's work as a war correspondent, arranged alphabetically by physical form

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typescript and printed copies of Jack Belden's writings and reviews of his books, arranged chronologically

did.unittitle: "In the Air" and "Japan's Drive on Hankow,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes a printed copy of the article

did.unittitle: Retreat with Stilwell and China Shakes the World,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Citation, instructions, maps, memorandum, press release, report, statement, and statistical data, relating to strategic planning and operations, arranged alphabetically by physical form

did.unittitle: Citation for War Department Distinguished Unit--16th U.S. Infantry Regiment and 1st U.S. Infantry Division,
Instructions to U.S. military government officers relating to the military government in Germany,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 12th Army group outline maps of France and Japan, including one reflecting the plan of Japanese operations against Hankow and action against Tienchiachen

did.unittitle: Report on coalition government, by Mao Tze-Tung (Mao, Zedong),
Statement by Colonel Myers to Jack Thompson about the organization of the army security force and the headquarters security force (Palace Guard) and the operations in which they were involved,
Statistical data on the German army,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Biographical details, correspondence, reports, and writings received as increments to the collection, arranged chronologically by the original series

did.unittitle: Biographical sketch probably written by Beatrice Weber in 1989 and introductory comments by R.K. McCabe,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes a letter to the editor from New York Times, 1989 June, and photocopies of all obituary messages

did.unittitle: Reports on China relating to drug trade, criminal activities, political terrorism in Shanghai, and a recollection of pre-war Shanghai by M. C. Ford, correspondent and editor of the Shanghai Evening Post,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Scrapbooks and writings by Jack Belden, arranged alphabetically by physical form

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Two volumes Writings by Jack Belden

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes an account and photocopies of photographs of the "Battle of Salerno"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photocopies of a photograph of Jack Belden's injured leg, undated, and cover page of Life, 1944 March 20
